decks.notes: The main idea of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures like Champion of Dusk and Knight of the Ebon Legion to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the opponent's game plan. Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord and Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet provide additional value and support to the aggressive game plan. The deck utilizes the strong synergy between vampires and provides a consistent and proactive game plan to outpace opponents.

The main concept of this Dimir Inverter deck is to use Inverter of Truth together with Thassa's Oracle to win the game through a combo. By manipulating the top of the library with cards like Dig Through Time, Opt, and Thoughtseize, the player aims to exile their entire library with Inverter of Truth's ability and then win the game by having Thassa's Oracle enter the battlefield and trigger its ability. The deck also includes control elements like Fatal Push, Thought Erasure, and Jace, Wielder of Mysteries to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect the combo.

This deck aims to establish early board presence with low mana cost creatures and disruption spells to control the game tempo. It also utilizes planeswalkers and enchantments for additional control and resilience. The focus is on maintaining a strong board presence while controlling the opponent's actions through counterspells and removal. The deck is designed to apply constant pressure while preventing the opponent from stabilizing, ultimately leading to a quick victory through a combination of aggression and control elements.

This deck focuses on quickly equipping artifacts with powerful effects to deal damage swiftly to the opponent. The key strategy is to use cards such as Ensoul Artifact and Skilled Animator to turn small artifacts into powerful attackers, while using cards like Bomat Courier and Shrapnel Blast to apply pressure and finish off the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Ghostfire Blade and Steel Overseer help to boost the power of the artifacts on the battlefield, ensuring a fast and aggressive playstyle.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently assemble the combo of Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game. In order to achieve this, the deck includes a mix of card draw, disruption, removal, and protection spells to help control the game while searching for the combo pieces. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up the win condition with either Jace, Wielder of Mysteries or Thassa's Oracle to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board by using a combination of enchantments and planeswalkers. By utilizing Fires of Invention to cast spells for free, the deck can quickly establish a dominant board presence. Cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Gideon's Intervention help lock down opponent's strategies, while enchantments like Sigil of the Empty Throne and Rest in Peace provide additional value and resources. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents with a heavy control style of play.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy centered around powerful black creatures and removal spells. The deck aims to curve out efficiently, disrupt the opponent's hand with Thoughtseize, and finish the game quickly with a combination of creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Champion of Dusk, backed up by removal spells like Fatal Push and Murderous Rider. The inclusion of Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord provides additional utility and synergy with the creature base, while the land base ensures consistent access to color requirements.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, dealing damage quickly and efficiently. By utilizing cards that are low in mana cost and high in damage output, this deck focuses on putting early pressure on the opponent and closing out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. With a mix of haste creatures, direct damage spells, and a land package that supports the aggressive strategy, this deck aims to win the game as fast as possible.

This Simic Aggro deck focuses on using creatures with the Merfolk creature type to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure. The deck aims to play aggressively and efficiently, using cards like Collected Company and Merfolk Trickster to disrupt opponents while building a strong board. Thassa, God of the Sea provides added card selection and resilience. The deck is also supported by countermagic with Wizard's Retort and provides some protection with Kopala, Warden of Waves. The mana base includes various dual lands and creature lands to ensure consistent and smooth gameplay.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize the combo of Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game by manipulating the library and graveyard. The deck includes cards like Censor, Thoughtseize, and Thought Erasure to disrupt the opponent's strategy while digging for combo pieces with cards like Dig Through Time and Opt. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Hero's Downfall to deal with threats on the board. Jace, Wielder of Mysteries is included as an alternate win condition in case the main combo is disrupted.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly flip your library so that you can win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. By using cards like Dig Through Time, Inverter of Truth, and Thoughtseize, you can manipulate your library and control your opponent's hand. Narset, Parter of Veils and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy help filter through your deck, while removal spells like Fatal Push help keep your opponent's threats in check. Overall, this deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently and protect them until you can secure the win.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful threats. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also providing card advantage and flexibility with cards like Opt, Discovery / Dispersal, and Quicken. The deck then closes out the game with powerful threats like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, Nicol Bolas, the Ravager, and Bonecrusher Giant. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's tri-color requirements.

This deck focuses on powerful control elements while utilizing the versatile Niv-Mizzet Reborn as the centerpiece of the strategy. The deck includes a mix of removal spells, hand disruption, and versatile threats to control the board and outvalue the opponent. With a toolbox approach using Bring to Light, the deck can adapt to various situations and answer a wide range of threats. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to the different colors needed for the deck's spells and to support the casting of Niv-Mizzet Reborn.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures while utilizing powerful aura cards to boost their abilities and protect them. With a focus on auras, the deck aims to quickly build up a strong board presence and control the game through enchantments like Sigil of the Empty Throne and Sphere of Safety. By combining aggressive creatures like Setessan Champion and Courser of Kruphix with auras like Wolfwillow Haven and Banishing Light, this deck aims to dominate the battlefield and outpace the opponent in a fast-paced Pioneer 1 vs 1 match.

The deck focuses on using control elements such as discard spells, removal, and creature threats to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gaining card advantage through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales. The deck also utilizes cards like Traverse the Ulvenwald to search for key creatures and lands, providing versatility and consistency. The addition of The Scarab God and Emrakul, the Promised End as powerful late-game threats adds a win condition that can take over the game if left unchecked.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats with burn spells, and generating value through card draw and token generation. The deck aims to maintain board presence and card advantage through efficient spells and powerful creatures like Young Pyromancer and Risen Reef. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Chandra, Acolyte of Flame to further control the board and provide additional value. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and allow for consistency in casting spells.
